intro: Lupsia galactites, commonly known as the milkweed vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered flowers in shades of pink and white. Its latex-like sap is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Lupsia galactites is often found climbing trees or shrubs in humid, shaded environments.
